ranked_diseases.explanation: The patient has proximal muscle weakness, Gowers sign, calf pseudohypertrophy, scoliosis, highly elevated creatine kinase, and difficulty climbing stairs, all of which are classic features of Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy.
Similar to Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy but with a milder progression. The presence of muscle weakness and elevated creatine kinase supports this diagnosis.
Characterized by proximal muscle weakness and elevated creatine kinase. Although rarer, it fits many of the muscle-related symptoms described.
This disease presents with muscle weakness and contractures from an early age, consistent with some of the features provided.
The proximal muscle weakness and motor delay may suggest a motor neuron disease such as Spinal Muscular Atrophy, though the lack of reference cases make this uncertain.
